answer.a_16: The white man fed the dogs.
answer.a_17: <select1,1,1>['The boys are baking the bread.', 'The girls are baking the bread.', 'The children are baking the bread.']
answer.a_18: The woman is chasing the boy.

explanation.rules:
Word order
S V (where S = subject of an intransitive verb; V = verb)
A-lu V P (where A = subject of a transitive verb; P = direct object)

Noun:
    women: P=rra-, S=rra-, A=rru-
    (♀) men: P=nya-, S=nya-, A=nyu-
    (♂) men = animals: P=ø-, S=ø-, A=ki-
    (♀) animals: P=ø-, S=ø-, A=ji-
    edible things: P=ma-, S=ma-
    pl (plural): P=li-, S=li-, A=linji-

Verb:
1. Tense Prefix:
    j- : present continuous
    k- : future/past
2. & 3. Object and Subject Prefixes:
    women: P=arr-, S=anda-, A=anda-
    (♀) men: P=any-, S=iwa-, A=ilu-
    (♂) men = animals: P=ø-, S=a-, A=ilu-
    (♀) animals: P=ø-, S=i-, A=inju-
    edible things: P=ø-, S=ø-, A=ø-
    pl (plural): P=al-, S=alu-, A=alu-
4. Verb Root
5. Tense Suffix:
    -ø : past
    -nji : present continuous
    -la : future

Word order A-lu V P (where A = subject of a transitive verb; P = direct object)

Noun: (♀) men: P=nya-, S=nya-, A=nyu-

Noun: edible things: P=ma-, S=ma-
Noun: pl (plural): P=li-, S=li-, A=linji-

Verb: 1. Tense Prefix: k- : future/past

Verb: 2. & 3. Object and Subject Prefixes: (♀) animals: P=ø-, S=i-, A=inju-
Verb: 2. & 3. Object and Subject Prefixes: edible things: P=ø-, S=ø-, A=ø-
Verb: 2. & 3. Object and Subject Prefixes: pl (plural): P=al-, S=alu-, A=alu-

Verb: 5. Tense Suffix: -nji : present continuous
